newsitem.title: BELGIUM: 700 on strike at Cockerill Sambre steelworks.
newsitem.headline: 700 on strike at Cockerill Sambre steelworks.

text.p: Production is continuing at three Cockerill Sambre steelworks near Charleroi in southern Belgium despite a 24-hour strike by 700 of 5,500 staff, union sources said on Tuesday.
The action, mainly by white-collar workers, started at 9:00 a.m. (0800 GMT). It was taking place at Couillet, Marcinelle and Marchienne.
A meeting of the socialist FGTB and christian CSC unions on Tuesday afternoon would discuss further action, possibly next week, and possibly by both blue- and white-collar workers, the sources said.
The unions oppose Cockerill's restructuring plan, called Horizon 2000, which they say could see 2,000 jobs shed over the next three years.

CSC spokesman Guy Fayet said: "This warning strike is necessary because 2,000 jobs are threatened and there is no provision for all affected workers to take early retirement. Inevitably, the company will lay workers off".
The strikers are to return to work on Wednesday.
